meanings.definition: A state of nervousness or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The children were in a tizz before the big game.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't hide her tizz when she saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's tail wagged in a tizz when it saw its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The city was in a tizz of anticipation before the grand fireworks display.
meanings.sent5: The tizz in the air was palpable as the students waited for their exam results.

meanings.definition: To make someone nervous or excited.
meanings.sent1: The magician's tricks always tizz the audience.
meanings.sent2: Don't tizz your little sister before her ballet recital.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to tizz the dog by pouncing on its tail.
meanings.sent4: The coach's pep talk tizzed the team up for the championship game.
meanings.sent5: The surprise announcement tizzed the crowd with anticipation.
